III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• When providing lists of employees as well as enrolled, open, and closed foster
homes, make sure all of the information is current.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was neither requested nor required.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The one
CAP was submitted in response to the 10/24/2024 licensing inspection report and
was approved on 11/6/2024. That CAP addressed three violations related to
personnel files. The CAP was effective as evidenced by none of those violations
being repeated during this inspection.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The chief administrator assessment was received and reviewed during the
entrance meeting. The chief administrator indicated the prior CAP was effective in
2

addressing the areas found in violation during the last inspection and there have
been no other incidents of non-compliance throughout the year.
Financial Overview
The chief administrator provided a fiscal year budget which presented no
concerns. An audit of all financial accounts covering the timeframe beginning
when the agency became licensed through the first fiscal year is scheduled to
begin in December 2025.
Staff Interviews
The staff members reported the agency has grown since the last inspection and
they have facilitated several respite placements. They are continuing to license
homes for the purpose of providing respite and support service to foster families
providing long term care. They reported an understanding of licensing rules and
expectations, and no concerns were reported.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment to provide for the delivery of
foster home certification services. All CHRI and foster home records are
maintained securely within CWLM. If the need arises to secure a physical
document/file, the agency has a large, lockable file cabinet.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns identified.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
